verses.text: 我夜間躺在床上，尋找我心所愛的，我尋找他，卻找不到他。

words.note: A particle used to form a nominalized phrase, often for passive or agentless actions.
Here, it nominalizes the phrase '我心所愛' to mean 'my heart's beloved one'.
Used as a verb complement to indicate successful completion of an action.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved about Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H3915"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 我說：「我要起來，走遍全城，在街上，在廣場上，尋找我心所愛的。」我尋找他，卻找不到他。
城中的守衛巡邏的時候，找著我；我就問他們：「你們有沒有看見我心所愛的？」

words.note: Forms an adverbial phrase, 'when the guards were patrolling'.
The suffix '著' indicates the successful result of the action.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Used with '有' to form a 'have/not have' yes/no question.

verses.text: 我剛剛離開他們，就遇見我心所愛的；我把他拉住，不讓他走，等到我帶他到我母親的家，進到懷我者的內室。

words.note: A grammatical particle used to move the object before the verb.
The complement '住' indicates firm attachment or holding.
Refers to conceiving or carrying in the womb.
Nominalizer, forming 'the one who bore me'.
Often refers to a private, intimate room in ancient contexts.

verses.text: 耶路撒冷的眾女子啊！我指著羚羊、田間的母鹿懇求你們，不要激動，不要挑動愛情，等它自發吧。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts to refer to a collective group.
Used at the end of a sentence to express exclamation or emphasis.
In biblical context, often means 'to swear by' someone or something.
Common imagery in Song of Songs, symbolizing grace and swiftness.
Another common imagery in Song of Songs, symbolizing elegance.
Often used in formal or solemn requests, like in prayer.
Used at the end of a sentence to indicate suggestion or mild command.

verses.heading: \+qt The Beloved to the Maidens:\+qt*

verses.text: 那從曠野上來，好像煙柱；用商人販賣的各種香粉、沒藥和乳香薰過的，是誰呢？

words.note: Aromatic gum resin, used for perfume and embalming.
Aromatic resin, used in perfumes and incense.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Speaker:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H4310"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 看哪！是所羅門的御轎，四周有六十個勇士，都是以色列中的勇士。

words.note: A sedan chair used by an emperor or royalty.

verses.text: 個個手拿武器，能征慣戰；各人腿上配有利劍，以防夜間的襲擊。

words.note: An idiom describing someone experienced in warfare.

verses.text: 所羅門王用黎巴嫩木，為自己做了一乘華轎。
他用銀子做轎柱，用金子做轎底，用紫色料子做轎的座墊；內部所鋪設的，是耶路撒冷眾女子的愛情。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb or agent of action.

verses.text: 錫安的眾女子啊！你們出來看看所羅門戴著的冠冕，就是在他結婚的日子，在他心裡喜樂的時候，他母親給他戴上的。

words.note: Often used as a prefix for groups (e.g., '眾人' - all people)
Reduplicated verb, softens the tone or indicates a brief action.
Connects a modifier to the noun it describes.
Often used for spiritual joy in religious texts.
